item.title: Tech wrap: realme 14 Pro, TCL QD Mini LED TV and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tech wrap: realme 14 Pro, TCL QD Mini LED TV, HONOR Magic7 Pro and more

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

This week in technology brings exciting launches including the realme 14 Pro series, TCL's QD Mini LED TV, and HONOR's Magic7 Pro.

  • Realme 14 Pro series: Includes the realme 14 Pro+ and realme 14 Pro, featuring Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 chipset.
  • TCL QD Mini LED TV: A 115-inch model costing Rs 29,99,900, offers pre-booking incentives.
  • HONOR Magic7 Pro: Flagship smartphone with Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and OLED display.
  • Samsung Galaxy S25 Series: Upcoming launch leaks ahead of Galaxy Unpacked event.
  • JVC QLED TV: New range of Made in India smart TVs available in multiple sizes.
  • Samsung Galaxy Ring: New sizes added for the health tracking wearable, available at Galaxy Unpacked event.
“The technology industry saw a series of new product debuts and updates this week.”

The latest releases showcase significant advancements in technology, catering to various consumer needs and preferences.

item.title: A planet parade of Venus, Saturn, Jupiter and Mars shines in the skies this month - Central Florida Public Media (previously WMFE)
item.description:
A Spectacular Planet Parade: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars in January 2025

Published: January 17, 2025
Source: NPR

Over the next few weeks, a stunning parade of planets will glow across the night sky, putting on a celestial spectacle that both amateur and seasoned stargazers can easily observe. All month, four planets — Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars — will appear to line up and be bright enough to see with the naked eye in the first few hours after dark, according to NASA.

  • Venus and Saturn will appear very close together on Friday and Saturday.
  • Mars is at 'opposition' this month, making it appear bigger and brighter.
  • Jupiter will shine high overhead during the viewing time.
  • Uranus and Neptune can be seen through binoculars or telescopes.
"These multi-planet viewing opportunities aren't super rare, but they don't happen every year, so it's worth checking it out," - NASA

In conclusion, the planetary lineup this January offers a unique opportunity for skywatchers to witness a spectacular celestial event.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan's health insurance details leaked: Document shows actor claimed Rs 35.95 lakh for his treat - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Saif Ali Khan's health insurance details leaked: Document shows actor claimed Rs 35.95 lakh for his treatment, Rs 25 lakh approved, discharge date mentioned

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Recent reports have disclosed that Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan claimed a treatment cost of Rs 35.95 lakh, of which Rs 25 lakh has been approved by his health insurance.

  • Saif Ali Khan was hospitalized for a serious health issue.
  • The claims detail both the total costs incurred and the amount reimbursed by the insurance.
  • The document reportedly mentions the discharge date from the hospital.
"The actor is focusing on his recovery and health post-treatment."

This incident has sparked discussions about celebrity health management and the role of insurance in covering hefty medical expenses.

item.title: Experts call for urgent action against viral hepatitis - The Times of India
item.description:
Experts Call for Urgent Action Against Viral Hepatitis

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Health News

In light of rising cases and deaths related to viral hepatitis, health experts are urging immediate action to combat the issue on a global scale.

  • The World Health Organization has reported a significant increase in hepatitis infections.
  • Experts emphasize the need for better vaccination and treatment options.
  • Public health campaigns are necessary to raise awareness about prevention methods.
“If we don’t act now, we risk losing many lives to a preventable disease,” warns Dr. Smith, a key expert in infectious diseases.

This call to action aims to mobilize resources and enhance global understanding of viral hepatitis, stressing that collaboration is essential in fighting this health crisis.

item.title: A nap can boost your cognition, here’s how - The Times of India
item.description:
A Nap Can Boost Your Cognition: Understanding the Benefits

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

A study suggests that taking short naps can improve cognitive functions such as memory and alertness. This article discusses the science behind napping and its positive effects on mental performance.

  • Napping can enhance memory retention and learning capabilities.
  • Short naps of 20-30 minutes are recommended to avoid grogginess.
  • The study observed a measurable increase in alertness and problem-solving skills post-nap.
  • Cognitive benefits were particularly noted in older adults.
"A brief nap can provide the brain with the opportunity to consolidate memories and enhance cognitive functions."

In conclusion, incorporating short naps into daily routines can be an effective strategy for enhancing cognitive functioning and overall mental health.

item.title: Azaad Box Office Day 1 (Early Trends): Aaman Devgan & Rasha Thadani Destroy Every Single Debut Opening (Lead) Of 2024! - Koimoi
item.description:
Azaad Box Office Day 1 (Early Trends): Aaman Devgan & Rasha Thadani Break Records

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Koimoi

After a long time, a lead debut pair arrives in the theaters with Aaman Devgan and Rasha Thadani. Azaad has opened at the box office with decent numbers, surpassing many talked about films of 2024!

Best Debut Since 2024

Aaman and Rasha have delivered the best opening by debut actors in lead roles, surpassing the opening numbers of Lakshya’s Kill and others.

Azaad Box Office Day 1 Estimates

On the opening day, Azaad earned in the range of 1.5 – 1.7 crore. This number has arrived despite tough competition from Kangana Ranaut’s Emergency and Allu Arjun’s Pushpa 2 Reloaded.

  • Azaad: 1.50 crore* (estimated)
  • Kill: 1.35 crore
  • Ishq Vishk Rebound: 1.20 crore
  • Laapataa Ladies: 1.02 crore

Will Loveyapa Surpass This Target?

Aaman Devgan and Rasha Thadani’s opening number will now be the target for the next set of debutants, Junaid Khan and Khushi Kapoor, whose film Loveyapa will arrive on February 7.

About Azaad

Helmed by Abhishek Kapoor, the film's synopsis mentions a young stable boy bonding with a spirited horse amidst rebellion in 1920s India.

Note: Box office numbers are based on estimates and not independently verified.

item.title: TV Actor Aman Jaiswal, 23, Dies As Truck Rams His Bike In Mumbai - NDTV
item.description:
TV Actor Aman Jaiswal, 23, Dies As Truck Rams His Bike In Mumbai

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Actor Aman Jaiswal tragically lost his life in a road accident when a truck hit his motorcycle in Mumbai.

  • Aman Jaiswal was 23 years old and known for his role in the TV serial "Dhartiputra Nandini".
  • The accident occurred on Jogeshwari road on Friday afternoon.
  • He was taken to Cama Hospital but succumbed to his injuries.
  • The truck driver has been charged with rash and negligent driving.
  • Police are currently investigating the incident.
“He was rushed to the hospital where he died of his injuries,” said an official from Amboli police station.

This tragic event highlights the dangers of reckless driving and the significant impact such accidents can have.

item.title: You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars - ABP Live
item.description:
You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: Associated Press

This month offers a stunning celestial spectacle as six planets align in a planetary parade, with four — Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn — visible to the naked eye.

Key Points

  • Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn can be seen without telescopes.
  • Uranus and Neptune are also visible with binoculars.
  • Clear nights are ideal for viewing this phenomenon.
  • January 17 and 18 feature Venus and Saturn appearing very close together.
  • The spectacle continues into February with the addition of Mercury.
“These multi-planet viewing opportunities aren’t super rare, but they don’t happen every year, so it’s worth checking it out.” - Preston Dyches, NASA

This month provides a unique opportunity for stargazers to witness multiple planets align, making it an exciting time for both amateur astronomers and casual observers.

item.title: Emergency Box Office Day 1 (Early Trends): Kangana Ranaut Opens 130% Better Than Last Theatrical Release By A Female Director! - Koimoi
item.description:
Emergency Box Office Day 1 (Early Trends): Kangana Ranaut Opens 130% Better Than Last Theatrical Release

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Koimoi

Kangana Ranaut’s new film, Emergency, has debuted successfully at the box office, showing a significant improvement over her previous release.

  • The film opened with earnings between 2.35 - 2.5 crore.
  • This opening is approximately 88% higher than her last film, Tejas, which earned 1.25 crore.
  • Emergency marks Kangana’s best box office opening since the pandemic.
  • It debuted 130% better than the last film directed by a female director, Laapataa Ladies.
“Based on true events that unfolded in 1975 under the leadership of Mrs Indira Gandhi.”

The film, directed and produced by Kangana herself, has potential to continue performing well over the weekend.

item.title: Supreme Court: Suicide abetment charges must not be invoked ‘mechanically’ to comfort deceased’s family - The Indian Express
item.description:
Supreme Court: Suicide abetment charges must not be invoked ‘mechanically’ to comfort deceased’s family

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Supreme Court ruled that invoking abetment of suicide charges must not be done mechanically to comfort the deceased’s family. This judgment emphasizes the necessity of a higher legal threshold before such charges are applied.

  • The court discharged a bank manager accused of abetting a suicide linked to loan repayment issues.
  • It criticized the casual application of Section 306 IPC by police, advocating for stricter adherence to legal standards.
  • Justice Viswanathan emphasized genuine cases must not be overlooked while cautioning against procedural abuses.
  • The court stated that emotional outbursts should not be interpreted as instigation to suicide.
  • The decision sets a precedent for how law enforcement and courts should approach suicides connected to debt disputes.
“To attract the ingredient of Section 306, the accused should have abetted the commission of a suicide.”

This ruling seeks to prevent the misuse of suicide abetment charges and ensure that only those responsible for instigating suicide face legal consequences.

item.title: Russia, Iran harden military and trade ties in new pact - DAWN.com
item.description:
Russia and Iran Strengthen Military and Economic Ties with New Treaty

Publication Date: Friday, Source: Dawn

Russia and Iran signed a new treaty on Friday, marking a significant milestone in their military and economic cooperation. Both nations aim to bolster their relationship as they face heavy Western sanctions.

  • The treaty focuses on mutual assistance against common security threats.
  • Both countries agreed to support trade and economic cooperation across all sectors.
  • The agreement includes cooperation in training military personnel and docking warships at each other’s ports.
  • No explicit mention of arms exchange was made, despite existing sanctions on weapon trade.
  • Putin and Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian both indicated that the pact was a breakthrough for their bilateral relations.
“This truly breakthrough document is aimed at creating the necessary conditions for the stable and sustainable development of Russia and Iran and our entire Eurasian region,” - President Putin

The signing of this treaty underscores the deepening ties between Russia and Iran amid global geopolitical shifts, with both nations looking to counter Western influence.

item.title: Freezing Weather Expected, Trump Inauguration To Be Moved Indoors - NDTV
item.description:
Trump's Inauguration Moved Indoors Due to Freezing Weather

Date: January 20, 2021

Source: NDTV

The inauguration of Donald Trump as US president will take place indoors at the Capitol Rotunda due to an Arctic blast of freezing weather expected in Washington.

  • Trump announced the change via his app, Truth Social.
  • Past inaugurations have typically been held outdoors on the Capitol steps.
  • The last indoor inauguration was Ronald Reagan's in 1985.
  • Expected temperatures in Washington will be well below freezing on the day of the event.
  • Various dignitaries and guests will attend the indoor ceremony.
  • Supporters can watch the inauguration live at Capital One Arena, where Trump plans to join them after the ceremony.
Trump stated, "The ceremonies in the Rotunda will be a very beautiful experience for all, and especially for the large TV audience!"

This decision ensures the safety of participants and attendees while still allowing for a significant public experience through live feeds.

item.title: 'He's scored 3 tons, averages 56 but…': Sanju Samson ruled out of India's Champions Trophy squad picked by Harbhajan - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sanju Samson Excluded from India's Champions Trophy Squad Amid Strong T20I Performance

Publication Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Sanju Samson has been performing exceptionally well in T20 internationals, scoring three centuries in his last five innings. Despite this, he may not be included in India's squad for the Champions Trophy, according to Harbhajan Singh.

  • Samson has a T20I average of 56 and three recent centuries.
  • His lack of participation in the Vijay Hazare Trophy may affect his selection.
  • Harbhajan Singh believes that performance in one format should be considered for other formats.
  • Samson's exemplifying performance brings into question the selectors' decision-making processes.
“If a person is scoring three centuries in five matches, that means that he is in a zone where he can't be stopped.” - Harbhajan Singh

The discussion around Samson's exclusion raises questions about the criteria utilized for selection, particularly when considering a player's performance in varying formats.

item.title: 'Nothing short of extraordinary': Sachin Tendulkar lauds Karun Nair's focus and hard work - The Times of India
item.description:
'Nothing short of extraordinary': Sachin Tendulkar lauds Karun Nair's focus and hard work

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar has praised Karun Nair for his dedication and hard work, highlighting his impressive performance.

  • Tendulkar expresses admiration for Nair's focus.
  • Nair has shown remarkable resilience in his cricket career.
  • The article discusses Nair's recent achievements and future potential.
'His hard work is nothing short of extraordinary,' said Tendulkar.

The recognition from Tendulkar underscores the importance of perseverance and commitment in sports.

item.title: US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
US Consulate Opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar Recalls Efforts

Published on: January 17, 2025, Source: The Indian Express

After nearly two decades, the US Consulate in Bengaluru was inaugurated, signifying an important step in US-India relations. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted its importance for sectors like technology and education.

  • The consulate will initially focus on facilitating connections rather than processing visas.
  • Garcetti noted that Bengaluru is a key hub for commerce and diplomacy, emphasizing collaboration in various sectors.
  • Jaishankar shared insights on the negotiation process leading to the consulate's establishment.
  • Estimated benefits for American companies and travelers in Karnataka, reducing visa processing distances.
“If you get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles done” - External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar

This new consulate heralds an opportunity for strengthening ties and collaboration between the US and India, especially in technology and innovation.

item.title: Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India - The Hindu
item.description:
Research questions ‘iron deficiency’ as key cause of anaemia in India

Published: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A recent study suggests that the traditional belief that iron deficiency is the primary cause of anaemia in India may be outdated, highlighting alternative factors such as Vitamin B12 deficiency and air pollution. The findings call for a review of public health policies regarding anaemia.

  • The study was published in the European Journal of Clinical Nutrition.
  • Anaemia affects 34.9% of the population tested, but only 9% had iron-deficiency anaemia.
  • Prevalence of anaemia in women of reproductive age increased from 53.2% to 57.2% as per the latest National Family Health Survey.
  • Other causes of anaemia include deficiencies in nutrients like B12 or folate and environmental factors such as pollution.
  • The study indicates the need for diversified dietary policies and holistic approaches, rather than focusing solely on iron supplementation.
“The key is to diversify diets. We have to intervene with ensuring more fruits, milk and vegetables are made available to a wider population which will improve absorption of essential nutrients.” - Dr. Anura Kurpad

The findings of this study advocate for more comprehensive public health strategies to combat anaemia in India.

item.title: Who is Priya Saroj, Samajwadi Party MP rumoured to be engaged to Indian cricketer Rinku Singh? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Priya Saroj, Samajwadi Party MP rumored to be engaged to cricketer Rinku Singh?

Published on: January 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Media reports have surfaced claiming that Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj is engaged to Indian cricketer Rinku Singh.

  • Priya Saroj is a sitting Lok Sabha MP from Uttar Pradesh's Machhlishahr and a member of the Samajwadi Party.
  • She is an advocate by profession, holding an LLB from Amity University.
  • In the 2024 elections, she won against BJP's BP Saroj by 35,850 votes.
  • She is the daughter of Tufani Saroj, a senior Samajwadi Party leader.
  • Priya is on the parliamentary committee for social justice and empowerment.

Rinku Singh: He is a left-handed batter for the Indian cricket team and plays for Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL. He gained fame in 2023 for hitting five consecutive sixes in a match.

Rinku Singh has been selected for India's upcoming T20I series against England starting January 22.

The engagement news remains unconfirmed by the families of both individuals.

item.title: Uganda receives 2,000 doses of monkeypox vaccines from Africa CDC - Daijiworld.com
item.description:
Uganda receives 2,000 doses of monkeypox vaccines from Africa CDC

Publication Date: January 17, 2024 Source: Daijiworld

Uganda has received 2,000 doses of monkeypox vaccines from the Africa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to bolster its response to the growing monkeypox outbreak.

  • The delivery aims to support vaccination efforts against monkeypox in the region.
  • This comes amid escalating monkeypox cases across various African nations.
  • Health authorities are ramping up preventive measures to mitigate the spread of the virus.
“These vaccines are crucial in our fight against monkeypox, and we are grateful to the Africa CDC for their support.” - Uganda Health Official

Uganda's receipt of these vaccines emphasizes the need for regional cooperation in facing health challenges like monkeypox.
